articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
I have spent the last 20 years by studying and working on different aspects of the relationship between human society, the built and the natural environment.
Between 2000 and 2010 I have studied and worked in design and architecture firms exploring the cultural and socio-economic drivers that shape the built environment. In 2010, after relocating to Cambodia I started working as a consultant and contractor in the development sector. I have designed urban upgrading in informal settlements, small community centres. In Nepal I had the opportunity of being part of the post-earthquake response and reconstruction.
In 2018, I took an MSc in Environmental Engineering at Newcastle University to better understand the relationship between the built and the natural environment. I was part of research projects on water quality and environmental risk assessment. This was also a great opportunity to acquire a sharper work methodology and learn new tools for assessment and analysis.
In 2020 I have started working in the emergency sector as water, sanitation and habitat project manager. I have worked in Sudan (ICRC), Liberia and Malawi (MSF) mostly on health facilities infrastrucutre, water supply and emergency response.

articles.title: Design and construction
articles.contents:
In the past 13 years I had the possibility of working in the construction sector as a designer, a supervisor and a project manager. The complexity and diversity of stakeholders involved in these projects gave me the opportunity to gain experience from a vary wide set of situations.
Aside from construction, I have planned and managed other type of activities such as training, university courses and educational summer camps. Working with people from various socio-cultural background improved my interpersonal skills.
Position covered in this area
Architectural designer / Lead architect while working in architectural and design firms I developed feasibility studies, conceptual and detailed design for residential, commercial and public building. I have also lead international design teams and acted as project coordinator.
Construction supervisor I was in charge of ensuring construction quality and timing for several projects including two schools and health clinic in Nepal rural areas, hospital rehabilitation. Since 2020 I have been involved in the set up / rehabilitation of hospital infrastructure (water supply, sanitation, waste).
Training and capacity building
Contractor
Contractor for AusAID, Cambodia 3.2013 - 08.2014
Commissioned by Australian Aid, the project required to design (in a participative mode), monitor and build five centers in the communities that were relocated due to railway expansion. The first phase of the project included design activities run with the communities to co-design each center. Focus group discussion using different medium were used to better visualize and communicate ideas. In the second phase of the project, construction was implemented within budget and time-frame.

articles.title: Built environment
articles.contents:
Contents


I have been working in design and construction of the built environment since 2007. In the first part (2007-2015) mostly as an architectural designer and site supervisor in East Asia (Japan, China and Cambodia). Since 2018, I started to work in construction management (Nepal) and water and sanitation (Sudan, Liberia, Malawi).
Below a summary of roles that I have been covering in this field.
Positions covered in the built environment sector
Water and Sanitation Project Manager | 2021-now | I have worked for Médecins Sans Frontières in liberia and Malawi and ICRC in Sudan. Work tasks included: rehabilitation of water supply lines,water pumps, sanitation facilities in health clinics. Construction of waste area, set-up of segregation and treatment activities.
Construction Manager | 2016-2018 | the biggest project I have managed was the post-earthquake construction of 2 schools and one clinic in Nepal. Task included managing a team of 4, supervising construction quality, managing budget and expense forecasting.
Contractor | 2012-2015 | while in Cambodia I have implemented projects in shelter construction, housing disaster response and community building construction for different INGO and donors such as AUSAid, Habitat for Humanity and People in Need.
Architect and designer | 2006-2012 | I have worked in different design firms in Italy, Japan, China and Nepal designing private houses, public buildings such as schools, factories and offices.

articles.title: Teaching, capacity building and research
articles.contents:
Teaching
I have worked in academia as tutor and as researcher in the fields of architecture, public space design. In the past few years I have been involved in creating a serie of workshops and course titled Street Life Studies. Their focus is on the use of public street spaces in cities around the world. Students observe place; as people, behaviors, systems, and spaces in both their formal and informal expressions.

Capacity building
Capacity building for construction workers is often a component of the project I have been involved in. I have organized and run courses on different topics related to construction and disaster preparedness. The key challenge in this type of activities is to find ways to communicate practical and theoretical knowledge to a wide and diverse audience. It is also essential to commmunicate the reasons behind guidelines and regulations so that workers do not only adopt them but understand their rationale.
